edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils
Interface SubstitutionFilter

public interface SubstitutionFilter

A filter that mutates nucleotides one at a time (i.e., without taking context into account).

Version:
$Id$
Author:
David Soergel

Method Summary
 byte filter(byte b)
          Mutate the provided nucleotide and return it.
 void filter(byte[] buffer)
          Mutate each nucleotide in the provided byte buffer, in place.
 void filter(byte[] buffer, int length)
          Mutate the first n nucleotides in the provided byte buffer, in place.
 

Method Detail

filter

byte filter(byte b)
            throws FilterException
Mutate the provided nucleotide and return it. Note that many implementations may actually change the nucleotide only rarely, so the returned byte will frequently be the same as the argument.

Parameters:
b - the byte representing the nucleotide character (simply cast from char)
Returns:
a byte containing the filtered nucleotide
Throws:
FilterException

filter

void filter(byte[] buffer)
            throws FilterException
Mutate each nucleotide in the provided byte buffer, in place.

Parameters:
buffer - a byte[] containing the nucleotide sequence to be mutated
Throws:
FilterException

filter

void filter(byte[] buffer,
            int length)
            throws FilterException
Mutate the first n nucleotides in the provided byte buffer, in place. Useful in cases where only the initial part of the buffer is valid.

Parameters:
buffer - a byte[] containing the nucleotide sequence to be mutated
length - the number of symbols to mutate
Throws:
FilterException
